website_summaries.verdict: Buyers who seek a comfortable pair without breaking the bank may be interested in what the Endeavor has to offer. Its beginner-friendly construction and anti-odor properties also receive praise from the climbing community. On the other hand, some feel dismayed with the shoe’s traction on outdoor rock surfaces. All in all, the Butora Endeavor may be an amazing option because of its characteristics, especially for those who plan to use it indoors.
pros: Many buyers find the Butora Endeavor to be an enchantingly comfortable climbing shoe
According to a handful of consumer reviews, its hemp lining is effective in preventing the foot from smelling bad
A majority of users say that it is a wonderful climbing piece for beginners
The edging performance of this Butora product astonishes a bunch of climbers
A minority of wearers love the minimal stretch that is offered by this climb-centric offering
A few senders confirm that this shoe presents a ton of value for its affordable price
cons: Several senders mention that the Butora Endeavor has lackluster grip performance on outdoor surfaces
Some shoppers state that its heel-hooking ability leaves a lot to be desired
Based on the evaluation of a few individuals, the shoe’s Velcro straps don’t hold up that well

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value - consider sizing up
customer_reviews.text: Very good beginner/gym shoes. I wear a loose-fitting 10.5 4E US in sneakers (asics) and sized up to 11 as per the manufacturer recommendation for a tight but comfortable fit. They're a little loose in the heel but that hasn't affected my climbing so far. Seriously, consider sizing up - a 10.5 or smaller would be pretty tight for me. At < $100 they're a great value as long as they don't suck, and they definitely don't. Haven't tried them on rock yet, but they seem precise and reasonably-but-not-super sensitive on plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love the feel of these
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner climbers. I purchased about 4 pairs of shoes before finally finding these. I absolutely love the feel of these. I have a narrow foot and the biggest issue I was having was that most shoes are loose on the sides even when my toes are in pain. These are snug all the way around. My toes are curled, sides are tight, and they are comfortable. Initial climbs I had issues with how slick the bottoms were, but that lasted about 1 afternoon climbing. The next time it was super sticky and no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t buy them 😕
customer_reviews.text: These shoes unfortunately aren’t that great. Even for the experienced to new climbers, you might find these shoes make climbing harder. Obviously not a very aggressive shoe. The originally had a slight curve to at least flat for longer routes. After a few session, they started to point upwards. This causes issues with smaller toe holds, slipping. Butora is a difficult company to work with. I won’t be purchasing any of their products anymore.
customer_reviews.author: LWoods

customer_reviews.title: Very tight fit, soles starting to wear out after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes after my first pair of Scarpa Origins needed to be resoled about a year into their use. They were highly reviewed, making me think that they would be great quality. The shoes themselves are a slightly tighter fit than I expected. I wish I got a half-size larger than what I did. In addition, it's only been 2 months since I've started climbing in these and the front rubber is already being chipped away. I'm an indoors gym climber at the V4-ish level, so I'm not pulling any crazy moves. It surprises me to see how much the shoes have worn out after just two months.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Shan

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: These run about 2 full sizes small I am a 9.5 street shoe I bought a 9.5 and 10.5 and had to return both way to much cramming in the 9.5 maybe an 11 will do but i ended up going with la sportiva tarantulace which I bought in store at rei cause I was fed up with buying and returning shoes lol . The la sportiva run on point with sizing. I will most like still buy a pair of endeavors though when I find my size in store I like the hemp lining and velcro feels like a very solid shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: These are of good quality but they do run about a size and a half to small. The seller was very easy to work with and a refund was soooooo simple.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: My first climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet. Bought these after trying other shoes that were to narrow. My sneaker size is 11, sized up to 12 after reading reviews. They fit snug but not tight. The width is good to. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I’m normally a 9 shoe I ordered 9.5. Perfect fit. The most comfortable climbing I’ve used but still perform great.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: Great climbing shoes and they fit on my 4E paddle feet. I still have to take them off between climbs, they're not that comfortable, but I don't sit there in agony when I'm halfway up a route.
customer_reviews.author: M. Karns

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my son-in-law wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son-in-law for Christmas and he loves them! Thanked me for buying him a gift that was exactly what he wanted and would be using often!
customer_reviews.author: The Schnauzer House

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great for their price
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for their price. Having the narrow/wide sizing options really helps you get a form fitting shoe. I wear a size 12 shoe normally and got a 12.5
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they just feel agressive but like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loove this climbing shoes. I bought em half a size smaller than my street shoe size for sport climbing ... they just feel agressive but like a glove, exactly how it should be fitted for sports climbing... i love em better than my older 5ten and more than my older sportiva
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: 5 and these fit me like a 10
customer_reviews.text: These shoes run incredibly small. I wear an 11.5 and these fit me like a 10. My feet were in pain from the moment I put them on. They might be a good shoe if you order a larger size, however for this purchase I was incredibly dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable climbing shoes I've tried!
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet, which makes them incredibly wide, also, and I have had a lot of trouble finding a beginner's climbing shoe that did not feel overly restrictive of my pancake feet. These are amazing shoes! I am a female, I might add, but loved the color of the men's green shoes. I am usually a 9/9.5 in street shoes, and purchased these in a size 10/43; they are wonderful. I could not be happier! Not to mention they are made completely out of hemp, so they are eco-friendly, too! Incredibly happy with my purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Velcro fails after a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro strap stopped working on my shoe after a few months. I met another person at the climbing gym who had the same issue. I emailed butora support but got nothing back. They are now totally unusable because the velcro just won't stay shut.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Abbasi

product_meta.title: Butora Men's Endeavor Rock Climbing Shoe
product_meta.description: ENDEAVOR is the climbing shoe that provides you with everything you need. Slightly asymmetrical, it follows the foot's outline giving you strength and accuracy. Lining made of eco-friendly hemp, synthetic fibre and natural leather, which fits perfectly, prevents rubbing and avoids bad smell. The tongue of the climbing shoe is split in two parts: the inner part, made of a highly breathable mesh fabric, and the outer part, made of Poron (R) and more stuffed, to absorb the pressure of Velcro straps. Thanks to the closure that is strengthened with three strips in order to improve the shoe fit, plus the 3D sole, ENDEAVOR will help you reach farther than you ever imagined. Available in wide shape. Product specific size information: Normal cut Fit: Normal Weight Weight single shoe: 64 g Climbing Shoes Applications: Bouldering Category: Beginner Climbing Shoe Material Lining: hemp Outer material: Microfibre Sole: Neo Fuse rubber Climbing Shoe Features Closure: Velcro fastener With adjustable straps Number of straps: 2 Heel construction: With heel strap Tongue: One-sided on the shaft Sole Sole stiffness: medium Design type: Continuous Preload: Without Downturn: Without Type bands: Slightly asymmetric Cut Tip of the shoe: Round
feature_bullets: Climbing Gear > Climbing Shoes > Trad. Climbing > Men's
